main event: An airline pilot observed a ball of fire with a tail moving at high speed over Milwaukee, Wisconsin on November 26, 1951.
interesting points: The object was described as having a tail about 200 feet long and was orange in color., The object approached silently, hovered, and then disappeared at an estimated speed of 2,000 m.p.h., The second pilot made an independent observation supporting the sighting., The incident lasted for about 2-3 minutes, with an estimated observation duration of 35 seconds in total., Various conclusions about the sighting included possibilities of it being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomena.
sighted object: ball of fire with a long tail
